body:
After adding a few debug prints, it looks like the `ConfiguredTargetKey`s for the exec platforms aren't subject to consistent alias resolution, resulting in some lookups for `@@platforms//host:host` and some for `@@bazel_tools//tools:host_platform`. I haven't figured out where the difference comes from, but this ends up causing the mismatch due to which the toolchain ends up missing.

cc @katre

milestone.title: 7.2.0 release blockers
milestone.description: Issues that should be fixed before 7.2.0 release.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.title: Simplify CI setup and use prebuilt protoc
add example of running same Java test suite on multiple JDK versions
issue.body: Inspired by a conversation on the Bazel Slack, I've converted my example of how to use `with_cfg.bzl` to run a suite of Java tests on multiple JDK versions from <https://github.com/mattnworb/bazel-java-test-suite-with_cfg-example> to an example/integration test in this repo.

body:
I'll take a quick look, but here's my first question (probably for @comius based on the blame annotations):

Why is [`proto_common.bzl%_use_toolchain` claiming `mandatory = False`](https://cs.opensource.google/bazel/bazel/+/master:src/main/starlark/builtins_bzl/common/proto/proto_common.bzl;drc=e6167784b9e5381d4756bf7ec1b79092f1a3080b;l=371) when [the actual toolchain-using code](https://cs.opensource.google/bazel/bazel/+/master:src/main/starlark/builtins_bzl/common/proto/proto_lang_toolchain.bzl;drc=8b8c1302c6f21cea1af6ce21975d6882b06e0159;l=36) is not prepared to receive a `None`?
And, as a matter of fact, setting `mandatory = True` causes your sample command to build, because now it can find a toolchain.

More notes:

Setting a toolchain as optional means that it is not required that the toolchain is present to pick an execution platform. That means that, given execution platforms A and B (in that priority order), where A does not have a proto toolchain but B does, with the proto toolchain being optional, exec platform A will be chosen. (And, in the current `proto_lang_toolchain` code, the rule implementation that crashes trying to dereference a `None` value).
